title:
Adaptive Robotic Tool-Tip Control Learning Considering Online Changes in
  Grasping State
authors: Kento Kawaharazuka and Kei Okada and Masayuki Inaba
abstract:
Various robotic tool manipulation methods have been developed so far.
However, to our knowledge, none of them have taken into account the fact that
the grasping state such as grasping position and tool angle can change at any
time during the tool manipulation. In addition, there are few studies that can
handle deformable tools. In this study, we develop a method for estimating the
position of a tool-tip, controlling the tool-tip, and handling online
adaptation to changes in the relationship between the body and the tool, using
a neural network including parametric bias. We demonstrate the effectiveness of
our method for online change in grasping state and for deformable tools, in
experiments using two different types of robots: axis-driven robot PR2 and
tendon-driven robot MusashiLarm.
